hints.label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
hints.title: Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)
hints.content:
8235: :label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8236: 
8237: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:
8238: 
8239: $$
8240: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8241: $$
8242: 
8243: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8244: 
8245: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8246: 1. **Geometric ergodicity** of the Markov chain on the alive state space
hints.raw_directive:
8232: ### 12.4.2. The Synergistic Drift Inequality
8233: 
8234: :::{prf:theorem} Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)
8235: :label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8236: 
8237: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:
8238: 
8239: $$
8240: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8241: $$
8242: 
8243: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8244: 
8245: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8246: 1. **Geometric ergodicity** of the Markov chain on the alive state space
8247: 2. **Exponential convergence** to the quasi-stationary distribution

hints.label: proof-thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
hints.content:
8251: :::{prf:proof}
8252: :label: proof-thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8253: **Proof Strategy (Complete proof requires both documents).**
8254: 
8255: This theorem combines the drift inequalities proven in this document (cloning operator) with those from the companion document (kinetic operator). We outline the proof strategy and indicate which results come from which document.
8256: 
8257: **What this document has proven (Chapters 10-12):**
8258: 
8259: From the cloning operator analysis, we have established:
8260: 
8261: 1. **Positional variance:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x$ (Theorem 10.3.1)
8262: 2. **Velocity variance:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v$ (bounded expansion, Lemma 10.4.1)
8263: 3. **Boundary potential:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b$ (Theorem 11.3.1)
8264: 4. **Inter-swarm error:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] \leq C_W$ (bounded expansion, Theorem 12.2.1)
8265: 
8266: **What the companion document proves:**
8267: 
8268: From the kinetic operator analysis (to be detailed in the companion document):
8269: 
8270: 5. **Inter-swarm contraction:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_W] \leq -\kappa_W V_W + C'_W$ (hypocoercive contraction)
8271: 6. **Velocity dissipation:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_v V_{\text{Var},v} + C'_v$ (friction dissipation)
8272: 7. **Position expansion:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq C'_x$ (diffusion expansion)
8273: 8. **Boundary expansion:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta W_b] \leq C'_b$ (potential climbing)
8274: 
8275: **Synthesis of the complete drift:**
8276: 
8277: The total one-step expectation for $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is:
8278: 
8279: $$
8280: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')]]
8281: $$
8282: 
8283: Expanding $V_{\text{total}} = V_W + c_V V_{\text{Var}} + c_B W_b$ where $V_{\text{Var}} = V_{\text{Var},x} + V_{\text{Var},v}$:
8284: 
8285: **Step 1: Cloning stage analysis.**
8286: 
8287: $$
8288: \begin{aligned}
8289: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{total}}] &\leq V_W + C_W + c_V(V_{\text{Var},x} - \kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x) \\
8290: &\quad + c_V(V_{\text{Var},v} + C_v) + c_B(W_b - \kappa_b W_b + C_b) \\
8291: &= (1 - c_V \kappa_x) V_{\text{Var},x} + V_{\text{Var},v} + V_W + (1 - c_B \kappa_b) W_b \\
8292: &\quad + C_W + c_V C_x + c_V C_v + c_B C_b
8293: \end{aligned}
8294: $$
8295: 
8296: **Step 2: Kinetic stage analysis.**
8297: 
8298: Applying the kinetic drift inequalities to the post-cloning state:
8299: 
8300: $$
8301: \begin{aligned}
8302: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{total}}]] &\leq (1 - c_V \kappa_x) (V_{\text{Var},x} + C'_x) \\
8303: &\quad + c_V(1 - \kappa_v) V_{\text{Var},v} + c_V C'_v \\
8304: &\quad + (1 - \kappa_W)(V_W + C_W) + C'_W \\
8305: &\quad + (1 - c_B \kappa_b)(W_b + C'_b) + c_B C_b + \text{cross terms}
8306: \end{aligned}
8307: $$
8308: 
8309: **Step 3: Choosing coupling constants.**
8310: 
8311: The coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ must be chosen to ensure net contraction of each component. Sufficient conditions are:
8312: 
8313: 1. **For positional variance:** $c_V \kappa_x > (1 - c_V \kappa_x) \cdot \frac{C'_x}{V_{\text{Var},x}}$ when $V_{\text{Var},x}$ is large
8314: 2. **For velocity variance:** $c_V \kappa_v > 1$ (kinetic dissipation dominates cloning expansion)
8315: 3. **For inter-swarm error:** $\kappa_W$ is chosen by the kinetic analysis such that $\kappa_W V_W > C_W + C'_W + \text{(cross terms)}$ when $V_W$ is large
8316: 4. **For boundary potential:** $c_B \kappa_b$ ensures contraction from both operators
8317: 
8318: When these conditions are satisfied (existence proven in companion document via explicit parameter construction), the total drift satisfies:
8319: 
8320: $$
8321: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8322: $$
8323: 
8324: where:
8325: - $\kappa_{\text{total}} = \min(\kappa_W, c_V \min(\kappa_x, \kappa_v - 1/c_V), c_B \kappa_b) > 0$ (when parameters are appropriately chosen)
8326: - $C_{\text{total}} = C_W + C'_W + c_V(C_x + C'_x + C_v + C'_v) + c_B(C_b + C'_b) < \infty$
8327: 
8328: **Conclusion:**
8329: 
8330: This document has rigorously proven the cloning operator drift inequalities (items 1-4). The companion document provides the kinetic operator drift inequalities (items 5-8). Together, these establish the Foster-Lyapunov condition for the full system, enabling the convergence results stated in the theorem.

hints.label: prop-coupling-constant-existence
hints.title: Existence of Valid Coupling Constants
hints.content:
8338: :label: prop-coupling-constant-existence
8339: 
8340: There exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ that satisfy the synergistic drift condition, provided the algorithmic parameters satisfy:
8341: 
8342: **Cloning Parameters:**
8343: - Sufficient measurement quality: $\epsilon > \epsilon_{\min}$ for detectable variance
8344: - Sufficient cloning responsiveness: $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}$ small, $p_{\max}$ large
8345: - Sufficient fitness weight on rewards: $\beta > 0$ for boundary detection
8346: 
8347: **Kinetic Parameters:**
8348: - Sufficient friction: $\gamma > \gamma_{\min}$ for velocity dissipation
8349: - Sufficient confinement: $\|\nabla U(x)\|$ large enough far from equilibrium
8350: - Small enough noise: $\sigma_v^2$ to prevent excessive velocity heating
8351: 
8352: **Balance Condition:**
8353: 
8354: $$
8355: \frac{\kappa_x}{\text{(kinetic diffusion)}} > 1, \quad \frac{\kappa_v}{\text{(cloning velocity expansion)}} > 1, \quad \frac{\kappa_W}{C_W} > 1
hints.raw_directive:
8335: ### 12.4.3. Parameter Balancing
8336: 
8337: :::{prf:proposition} Existence of Valid Coupling Constants
8338: :label: prop-coupling-constant-existence
8339: 
8340: There exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ that satisfy the synergistic drift condition, provided the algorithmic parameters satisfy:
8341: 
8342: **Cloning Parameters:**
8343: - Sufficient measurement quality: $\epsilon > \epsilon_{\min}$ for detectable variance
8344: - Sufficient cloning responsiveness: $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}$ small, $p_{\max}$ large
8345: - Sufficient fitness weight on rewards: $\beta > 0$ for boundary detection
8346: 
8347: **Kinetic Parameters:**
8348: - Sufficient friction: $\gamma > \gamma_{\min}$ for velocity dissipation
8349: - Sufficient confinement: $\|\nabla U(x)\|$ large enough far from equilibrium
8350: - Small enough noise: $\sigma_v^2$ to prevent excessive velocity heating
8351: 
8352: **Balance Condition:**
8353: 
8354: $$
8355: \frac{\kappa_x}{\text{(kinetic diffusion)}} > 1, \quad \frac{\kappa_v}{\text{(cloning velocity expansion)}} > 1, \quad \frac{\kappa_W}{C_W} > 1
8356: $$

hints.label: rem-tuning-guidance
hints.title: Tuning Guidance
hints.content:
8378: :label: rem-tuning-guidance
8379: 
8380: In practice, the coupling constants are chosen as:
8381: 
8382: $$
8383: c_V \approx \frac{\kappa_W}{2\kappa_x}, \quad c_B \approx \frac{\kappa_W}{2\kappa_b}
8384: $$
8385: 
8386: This balances the contraction rates across components, ensuring no single component dominates the drift inequality. The factor of 2 provides safety margin.
8387: 
8388: If the system is experiencing:
8389: - **High boundary exposure:** Increase $c_B$ to weight safety more heavily
